alert.note: Alert for Andrew; Buchanan; Clinton; DeKalb; Gentry; Nodaway; Platte (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 20 at 4:57AM CDT until April 20 at 5:45AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pleasant Hill has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Doniphan County in northeastern Kansas... Eastern Atchison County in northeastern Kansas... Buchanan County in northwestern Missouri... Clinton County in northwestern Missouri... Gentry County in northwestern Missouri... Southeastern Nodaway County in northwestern Missouri... Northern Platte County in west central Missouri... Andrew County in northwestern Missouri... DeKalb County in northwestern Missouri... * Until 545 AM CDT. * At 457 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles south of Maryville to near Savannah to near St. Joseph to near Atchison, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... St. Joseph, Atchison, Cameron, Savannah, Plattsburg, Lathrop, Albany, Gower, Wathena, Elwood, Stanberry, Maysville, Country Club Villa, Country Club, King City, Stewartsville, Agency, Trimble, Edgerton and Dearborn. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 52 and 55. Interstate 29 between mile markers 25 and 62. Interstate 229 between mile markers 0 and 14. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Andrew; Buchanan; Clinton; DeKalb; Gentry; Nodaway; Platte
